snippet: The company reported net income of $781 million, or 26 cents a share, down from $908 million, or 30 cents a share, a year earlier.
abstract: Merck forms alliance with Amgen, Incyte and Pfizer to test its experimental cancer drug; reports fourth-quarter profit of $731 million, or 26 cents a share, down 14 percent from $908 million, or 30 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue was $2.6 billion.
lead_paragraph: The company reported net income of $781 million, or 26 cents a share, down from $908 million, or 30 cents a share, a year earlier.

headline.main: Profit Drops 14% at Merck, Just Below Wall St. Forecast
headline.print_headline: Merck Forms Cancer Drug Alliance With 3 Firms
